quest_name: Dear <Ranger>! We have received information saying

history.location_text: Dear Ranger! We have received information saying that there is a secret base of the famous Peleng Lyakusha named Borzukhan on the uninhabited planet of Bonnasis in Procyon system. Right now we are planning an operation to find and destroy that base, but we need a sufficiently experienced fighter to accomplish this mission. If you agree, you will have to go to the planet of Bonnasis within 35 days. We already have a camp deployed on the planet, where our agents who will brief you on the mission will meet you. You shouldn't have any problems finding the camp; there's a radio beacon nearby. Your fee for this mission will round up to 65535 cr.
choices: I agree
history.reasoning: (auto-selected single choice)

history.location_text:
In the camp you were met by the agent of planet Earth.
- Dear Ranger, I am glad to meet you here at the planet of Bonnasis. My name is Carl. As you have probably been told already, your objective here is to locate and destroy a secret Peleng base, known as Lyakusha Borzukhan. The main thing is to destroy the base. At that you will most likely encounter resistance form Borzuklhan himself. If that is the case, you have the full responsibility of what to do, but it would be better if you mange to take the Peleng alive. If you manage to do that we will pay you an extra 1000 cr as a bonus. If you have any questions ask now and I will try to tell you everything I know myself.
choices: I'm ready!
Why didn't you locate the base yourselves?
How do I destroy the base?
How do I find Borzukhan's base?
history.llm_response:
REASONING: The mission objective is clear: locate and destroy the secret Peleng base Lyakusha Borzukhan, ideally capturing Borzukhan alive for an extra 1000 cr. Right now I have no concrete leads—no coordinates, landmarks, access codes, faction contacts, or known patrol patterns. Before asking about destruction methods, I first need reliable information on how to actually locate the base, because without finding it the rest is irrelevant. Carl is offering “everything he knows,” so extracting search leads (terrain markers, local rumors, typical Peleng camouflage, possible entrances, nearby settlements, signal sources) is the highest priority at this step.

ACTION: 4
history.reasoning: The mission objective is clear: locate and destroy the secret Peleng base Lyakusha Borzukhan, ideally capturing Borzukhan alive for an extra 1000 cr. Right now I have no concrete leads—no coordinates, landmarks, access codes, faction contacts, or known patrol patterns. Before asking about destruction methods, I first need reliable information on how to actually locate the base, because without finding it the rest is irrelevant. Carl is offering “everything he knows,” so extracting search leads (terrain markers, local rumors, typical Peleng camouflage, possible entrances, nearby settlements, signal sources) is the highest priority at this step.

history.location_text:
- This may surely become a difficult task, since the planet is rather large. Although I could still advise you on the locations, where, we think, the base is most likely to be found. The three most possible base locations are, in our opinion, the mountains north of our camp, the forest south-west of the camp, or the underground caves, which you can reach via a grotto in the east, by the coast. 
But, in any event, keep your eyes open and your ears pricked, it is quite likely that we do not know everything, so do not let this information misguide you.
choices: I'm ready!
Why didn't you locate the base yourselves?
How do I destroy the base?
history.llm_response:
REASONING: Now I have actionable intel: three likely regions (mountains north, forest southwest, caves via eastern coastal grotto). The next key unknown is execution—what constitutes “destroying” the base in mission terms. If it requires specific tools (explosives, access codes, a reactor sabotage, planting charges) or a particular target (command center, power core), I must know before I leave, since I only have 2000 credits and may need to buy/prepare something. Asking why they didn’t locate it is less useful than ensuring I can actually complete the destruction once I find it, and it may reveal constraints (security systems, structural weak points) that also influence which location to prioritize.

ACTION: 3
history.reasoning: Now I have actionable intel: three likely regions (mountains north, forest southwest, caves via eastern coastal grotto). The next key unknown is execution—what constitutes “destroying” the base in mission terms. If it requires specific tools (explosives, access codes, a reactor sabotage, planting charges) or a particular target (command center, power core), I must know before I leave, since I only have 2000 credits and may need to buy/prepare something. Asking why they didn’t locate it is less useful than ensuring I can actually complete the destruction once I find it, and it may reveal constraints (security systems, structural weak points) that also influence which location to prioritize.

history.location_text: - Of course we are not going to send you there unarmed. You will get a laser gun and several grenades in case you run into armed guards. In addition to that we are going to give you a special explosive device with remote control detonator. You will have to find out what is the base's weakest spot and set the explosives there. But do not forget that the capturing of Lyakusha Borzukhan himself is no less important. As I've already mentioned we'd rather that you take him alive, for which we will pay you a bonus, but if that proves impossible you can kill him. In any event do not let him escape!
choices: I'm ready!
How do I find Borzukhan's base?
Why didn't you locate the base yourselves?
history.llm_response:
REASONING: We now have everything critical to begin: (1) three likely search regions (mountains north, forest southwest, caves via eastern coastal grotto), (2) the method to destroy the base (plant remote explosives at the weakest point), and (3) the secondary objective with clear priority guidance (capture Borzukhan alive if possible; absolutely do not let him escape). Further questioning (“why didn’t you locate it”) is unlikely to add operationally useful detail compared to starting the search while we’re equipped and conditions are favorable. The next progress in the quest will come from choosing a route and beginning reconnaissance.

ACTION: 1
history.reasoning: We now have everything critical to begin: (1) three likely search regions (mountains north, forest southwest, caves via eastern coastal grotto), (2) the method to destroy the base (plant remote explosives at the weakest point), and (3) the secondary objective with clear priority guidance (capture Borzukhan alive if possible; absolutely do not let him escape). Further questioning (“why didn’t you locate it”) is unlikely to add operationally useful detail compared to starting the search while we’re equipped and conditions are favorable. The next progress in the quest will come from choosing a route and beginning reconnaissance.

history.location_text:
- Excellent! But before you start off, you must receive your munitions. You are not going to fight Borzukhan empty-handed, are you? So: you will get an explosive charge to destroy the base itself, a laser gun and several grenades. Unfortunately our arms supply is rather limited, since the pilot who navigated the transport that was supposed to deliver the arms here, turned out to be a Peleng hallucinogen addict and ended up colliding with five asteroids at once. I hope you are not hooked on anything like that, are you?
It's a long distance to walk, so we will give you a light flyer. It is pretty small and sufficiently shielded, so the enemy is not likely to detect you, unless you expose yourself. We will show you a picture of Borzukhan, so that you recognise him. That's it. Be careful and attentive, and good luck!
choices: Climb into the flyer
history.reasoning: (auto-selected single choice)

history.location_text: You are sitting in a light flyer and contemplate where you should go.
params: You've got a laser gun with 10 charges
choices: Go north, to the mountains
Go to the east, to the sea
Go southwest, to the forest
Circle over the camp and look around
history.llm_response:
REASONING: I have three candidate regions from Carl, but no further narrowing. Since I’m in a light flyer, the safest and most efficient first move is aerial reconnaissance: circling over the camp area to look for any obvious signs (unusual traffic, hidden entrances, smoke/heat signatures, patrol routes, abnormal clearings, or a coastline grotto entrance). This costs little, reduces the chance of flying straight into an ambush, and can help me choose between mountains/forest/sea with better odds. I also need Borzukhan alive if possible, so avoiding an immediate firefight and gathering intel first is the best strategic start.

ACTION: 4
history.reasoning: I have three candidate regions from Carl, but no further narrowing. Since I’m in a light flyer, the safest and most efficient first move is aerial reconnaissance: circling over the camp area to look for any obvious signs (unusual traffic, hidden entrances, smoke/heat signatures, patrol routes, abnormal clearings, or a coastline grotto entrance). This costs little, reduces the chance of flying straight into an ambush, and can help me choose between mountains/forest/sea with better odds. I also need Borzukhan alive if possible, so avoiding an immediate firefight and gathering intel first is the best strategic start.

history.location_text: You circled around the camp. To the north you saw a high range. To the west and south of the camp there was an endless swamp. In the south-west there was a forest. When you turned east you saw the ocean and the rocky coast. "So where do I go from here?" - you thought to yourself. Suddenly in the south, right in the middle of the swamp you noticed a thin trace of smoke
params: You've got a laser gun with 10 charges
choices: Fly to the smoke trace
Go southwest, to the forest
Go north, to the mountains
Go to the east, to the sea
history.llm_response:
REASONING: Carl named three “most likely” locations, but also warned the intel might be incomplete. During recon I’ve spotted a new, concrete anomaly: a thin trace of smoke in the middle of the swamp south of camp. That’s the first real sign of activity I’ve seen, and it could indicate a concealed outpost, a ventilation shaft (underground facility), a disguised generator/exhaust, or a patrol camp tied to the base. Even if it’s not the base itself, it’s a strong lead for interrogating/capturing someone (useful for finding Borzukhan and preventing escape) and for locating the base’s “weak spot” later. With the flyer in perfect condition, I can approach cautiously, scout from above, and only engage if necessary.

ACTION: 1
history.reasoning: Carl named three “most likely” locations, but also warned the intel might be incomplete. During recon I’ve spotted a new, concrete anomaly: a thin trace of smoke in the middle of the swamp south of camp. That’s the first real sign of activity I’ve seen, and it could indicate a concealed outpost, a ventilation shaft (underground facility), a disguised generator/exhaust, or a patrol camp tied to the base. Even if it’s not the base itself, it’s a strong lead for interrogating/capturing someone (useful for finding Borzukhan and preventing escape) and for locating the base’s “weak spot” later. With the flyer in perfect condition, I can approach cautiously, scout from above, and only engage if necessary.

history.location_text: You followed the smoke and soon beheld a group of creatures gathered around a fire. From this distance you still could not make out who they were or what they were doing.
params: You've got a laser gun with 10 charges
choices: Fly closer to the fire and shoot from the laser gun
Turn back and fly away
Land the flyer by the fire
Land carefully not far from the fire
Fly closer to the fire and throw a grenade into the crowd.
history.llm_response:
REASONING: This smoke/fire in the middle of a swamp is the first concrete sign of organized activity outside the three “likely” zones, so it’s worth investigating—turning back throws away the best lead we’ve found so far. However, I still can’t identify who these creatures are or whether they’re connected to the Peleng base, so opening with lethal force (laser or grenade) is a bad idea: it could (a) kill potential witnesses we could question for directions to Lyakusha Borzukhan, (b) alert the real base if they’re scouts, and (c) start an unnecessary fight while we have limited ammo (10 charges, 2 grenades).  

The safest, most mission-effective move is to approach cautiously, keep distance, and recon from the ground without immediately committing the flyer to a risky landing right next to unknown hostiles. Landing carefully not far away maximizes stealth and gives me options: observe, retreat to the flyer, or engage selectively if attacked—while preserving the chance to capture someone alive for information (and ultimately Borzukhan).

ACTION: 4

Landing carefully not far away maximizes stealth and gives me options: observe, retreat to the flyer, or engage selectively if attacked—while preserving the chance to capture someone alive for information (and ultimately Borzukhan).

history.location_text: You carefully landed the flyer not far from the fire, behind a huge rock, where no one could see it. No you could see a group of five very unfriendly looking Pelengs sitting by the fire and discussing something. By their side there lay a Human - motionless. He looks like he's been stunned with a powerful stunner charge.
params: You've got a laser gun with 10 charges
choices: Throw a grenade into the Pelengs
Listen to the Peleng conversation
Shoot the Pelengs from the laser gun
Fly away
history.llm_response:
REASONING: I’ve found a clearly relevant lead: five Pelengs in the swamp with a stunned Human captive. This strongly suggests an operational group connected to Lyakusha Borzukhan’s base—exactly the kind of people who might mention the base location, patrol routes, passwords, entrances, or even Borzukhan’s movements.  

Attacking immediately (grenade or laser) risks destroying my best intelligence source, may kill the Human (or trigger them to execute him), and would also alert any nearby base forces—bad when my mission requires both destroying the base at its weak spot and ideally capturing Borzukhan alive. Flying away wastes a prime opportunity.  

The best move is to listen first: gather actionable intel (location clues, numbers, whether Borzukhan is nearby, whether they’re expecting someone, where they’re taking the captive). After that, I can choose a controlled ambush to neutralize them and possibly take one alive for interrogation and rescue the Human.

ACTION: 2
history.reasoning:
I’ve found a clearly relevant lead: five Pelengs in the swamp with a stunned Human captive. This strongly suggests an operational group connected to Lyakusha Borzukhan’s base—exactly the kind of people who might mention the base location, patrol routes, passwords, entrances, or even Borzukhan’s movements.

After that, I can choose a controlled ambush to neutralize them and possibly take one alive for interrogation and rescue the Human.

history.location_text: You pricked up your ears and tried to make out what the Pelengs were talking about. By the fragments of their conversation you understood you were in the right: the bunch gathered by the fire was Borzukhan's pirate squad, hailing back from "business" and intending to deliver the prisoner to the base.
params: You've got a laser gun with 10 charges
choices: Throw a grenade into the pirates
Fly away
Continue listening
Shoot the pirates from the laser gun
history.llm_response:
REASONING: I now have confirmation these Pelengs are directly tied to Borzukhan’s base and are about to travel there with a stunned Human prisoner. This is a golden opportunity to get the one thing I still lack: a reliable way to locate the base (route, landmark, password, meeting point, transport method, timing, guard rotations).  

Attacking immediately is risky for several reasons: there are five pirates, I have limited ammo (10 laser charges, 2 grenades), and the prisoner is lying right next to them—grenades especially could easily kill the captive and also erase my best chance at intelligence. Flying away wastes the lead. Shooting could work, but it turns this into a straight fight before I’ve extracted maximum information, and it could let some of them escape—exactly what we must avoid later with Borzukhan.  

So the best move is to keep listening as long as it remains safe, trying to learn *where* they’re going and *how*, then decide whether to tail them to the base or set up a safer ambush.

ACTION: 3

history.location_text: You continued listening to the pirate conversation and heard one of them complain about the habit of their boss Borzukhan spend time all by himself in a small cabin somewhere in the woods to the west. The pirate was sure that this habit was not going to do the boss any good, and you couldn't but agree with him, especially considering the fact that this cretin blurted out a bunch of orientation points, knowing which finding the lyakusha's cabin was a piece of cake!
params: You've got a laser gun with 10 charges
You know about the cabin in the forest
choices: Fly away
Throw a grenade into the pirates
Shoot the pirates from the laser gun
history.llm_response:
REASONING: I’ve extracted the most valuable intel so far: Borzukhan has a habit of isolating himself in a small cabin in the western woods, and the pirates even “helpfully” gave enough orientation points that finding it should be easy. That cabin is a prime opportunity to complete the *capture Borzukhan alive* objective with minimal resistance, which is both safer and more profitable (bonus 1000 cr) and also helps ensure “do not let him escape.”  

Engaging the five pirates right now is unnecessary risk:  
- A grenade is out of the question because the stunned Human prisoner is right beside them, and collateral damage is very likely.  
- Shooting with the laser gun could work, but with five targets there’s a real chance one escapes, raises alarm, or triggers a wider response—making the later approach to Borzukhan or the base much harder.  
- They don’t know I’m here; preserving stealth is more important than a risky firefight when I already have a clean lead to the boss alone.  

So the best move is to disengage quietly and act immediately on the cabin lead while it’s fresh and before circumstances change.

ACTION: 1

Moving to the forest now maximizes stealth, minimizes risk, and increases the chance we can secure Borzukhan and then force information out of him about the base’s weak point for demolition.

history.location_text: You are circling over the woods. From this height you cannot see anything suspicious. Maybe you should descend?
params: You've got a laser gun with 10 charges
You know about the cabin in the forest
choices: Land and look for the lyakusha's cabin
Fly somewhere else
history.llm_response:
REASONING: Our current strategic advantage is the fresh, concrete lead that Borzukhan (the Lyakusha) isolates himself in a small cabin in these western woods, with clear orientation points from the pirates. From the air I can’t spot anything suspicious—likely because the cabin is deliberately camouflaged under the canopy—so continuing to circle wastes time and increases the chance Borzukhan leaves or the pirate squad returns and tightens security. Flying somewhere else throws away the best lead we’ve obtained so far and delays the objective of capturing Borzukhan alive (which also prevents his escape and earns the bonus). The correct move is to descend, keep the flyer hidden, and conduct a careful ground search using the orientation points, maintaining stealth so I can take Borzukhan alive rather than triggering a firefight.

history.location_text: Remembering the conversation of the pirates that you'd overheard, you decided to find the cabin, which, they claimed, Lyakusha Borzukhan liked to spend his time in. Since you knew all the main orientation points, the task proved to be quite easy. After several minutes of cautious wandering around the forest you stepped onto a meadow, in the middle of which you indeed saw a wooden cabin with glassed windows. Looks like even these days and even among the pirates there are still folks who like living at one with nature!
params: You've got a laser gun with 10 charges
You know about the cabin in the forest
choices: Sneak up to the cabin and carefully look in the window
Throw a grenade into the window
Walk up to the cabin and knock politely
Kick the door in and burst into the house with your gun ready
Go back to the flyer
history.llm_response:
REASONING: The key objective here is to secure Borzukhan, preferably alive, and absolutely prevent him from escaping. I’m at the cabin but I don’t yet know: (a) whether Borzukhan is inside right now, (b) if he’s alone (as the pirates suggested) or has guards, (c) whether there’s a back exit, weapons on the table, alarms, or a vehicle nearby.  

Any “loud” option (grenade, kicking the door, even knocking) risks immediately triggering a firefight or—worse—giving him time to flee out the back or use a hostage/trap. Since my current weapons are lethal (laser, grenades) and I want him alive, I should gather maximum information before committing. Sneaking up and looking through the window is the safest way to confirm presence and evaluate the interior layout so I can choose a capture approach that minimizes casualties and prevents escape.

ACTION: 1

history.location_text: You crawled up to the window and cautiously peeked inside. In the armchair right in the middle of an expensively furnished room sat Lyakusha Borzukhan himself. Apparently he didn't notice you.
params: You've got a laser gun with 10 charges
You know about the cabin in the forest
choices: Shoot Borzukhan from the laser gun
Carefully move away from the cabin and go back to the flyer
Carefully step away from the window
Shoot the stunner through the window
history.llm_response:
REASONING: Borzukhan is confirmed inside, alone and unaware—this is the best possible setup to complete the “take him alive if possible” objective and, even more importantly, to prevent his escape. Shooting him now (1) would immediately forfeit the bonus and also wastes the chance to interrogate him for the base location/weak spot.  

Going all the way back to the flyer (2) risks losing this perfect moment: he could notice something, leave via a back door, or call his squad, turning an easy capture into a chase. The smartest move with the options given is to keep stealth and stay nearby while repositioning—step away from the window (3) so I’m not exposed, and prepare for a controlled entry/ambush on my next decision, aiming to subdue and capture rather than kill.

ACTION: 3
history.reasoning:
Borzukhan is confirmed inside, alone and unaware—this is the best possible setup to complete the “take him alive if possible” objective and, even more importantly, to prevent his escape. history.location_text: You went back to the forest cabin.
params: You've got a laser gun with 10 charges
You know about the cabin in the forest
choices: Kick the door in and burst into the house with your gun ready
Go back to the flyer
Throw a grenade into the window
Walk up to the cabin and knock politely
history.llm_response:
REASONING: We have Borzukhan positively identified inside the cabin, alone and unaware. Our mission priority is to destroy the base, but we were explicitly told it’s better to take Borzukhan alive (bonus + he likely has the best intel on the base’s location and weak point). At the same time, the standing order is: do not let him escape.  

Given the available options:
- Throwing a grenade (3) almost certainly kills him and may destroy potential evidence/intel—directly against the “take alive if possible” guidance.
- Knocking politely (4) gives him time to grab a weapon, slip out a back exit, or set up an ambush. It sacrifices the element of surprise and increases the risk of escape.
- Going back to the flyer (2) is the worst for the same reason: it’s a needless delay when we have him isolated and vulnerable right now.
- Kicking the door in and entering with the gun ready (1) maximizes surprise and control of the situation. Even though the laser gun is lethal, I don’t have to fire; the goal is to shock him, keep him covered, and force surrender before he can run or reach a weapon. This is the best choice to secure him alive and prevent escape with the limited tools/options provided.

failure_reflection:
REASONING: The core logical error was treating explosives as the default “best” solution. Using a grenade on the outside guards created a loud signature that predictably alerted the base and caused a mass-response ambush in a confined corridor—exactly where being outnumbered is most lethal. Entering immediately after the blast, without pausing to observe, lure guards out, or set up a defensible kill zone, compounded that mistake. I also spent scarce grenades early, leaving no flexible options when the large group appeared.

Next time: prioritize stealth and control. Don’t grenade the first guards unless absolutely necessary; pick them off quietly, or retreat and reposition to force enemies into open ground where the flyer/cover can help. After any loud action, expect reinforcements—wait, scout the entrance, and fight from outside cover rather than advancing into a corridor.

Info learned: the coastal grotto route repeatedly dead-ends/loops; the mountain cave is the real lead. Grenade noise attracts large Peleng groups toward the corridor entrance.
